title: Smart motorways are a scandal – it's time to end this deadly experiment
text:
Smart motorways, then. No doubt you’ve heard the term bandied about a fair bit in recent weeks. First we found out, thanks to a report by the AA, that breakdowns were deemed an astonishing 216 per cent more dangerous on smart motorways than on old-fashioned 'dumb' ones, according to Highways England’s own analysis.

Then we learned that the widow of a man killed on a stretch of the M1 that had been converted to run as a smart motorway is to sue Highways England for corporate manslaughter.

And hot on the heels of these revelations came the news that that the same stretch of motorway – on which three more people lost their lives in 10 months – has generated an astonishing £6 million in speeding...
